meta.title: Consulting | Jacek Janczura
meta.description: AI & Cloud consulting: enterprise LLM platforms, RAG, PromptOps/evals, AWS architecture, and AI developer enablement (Cursor/Claude Code). Engagement types: advisory, architecture reviews, delivery sprints.

hero.title: Consulting
hero.subtitle: How I work and how engagements typically look

intro.p1: I help teams ship secure, scalable AI systems—from LLM platforms and RAG to AWS architecture and operational excellence.
intro.p2: My focus is measurable outcomes: reliability, cost/performance, security/compliance, and a delivery approach that fits how your organization actually operates.

items.title: Advisory / Fractional Leadership
items.description: Hands-on guidance for strategy, technical direction, architecture decisions, and delivery standards—especially when you’re building or scaling an AI platform.
deliverables: Roadmap shaping and delivery standards (quality gates, reviews, rollout)

items.title: AI Architecture Review (LLM / RAG / Cloud)
items.description: A structured assessment of your current system (or planned design) with concrete recommendations you can execute.
deliverables: Plan for reliability, observability, and cost control

items.title: Delivery Sprint (production-grade thin slice)
items.description: Ship a focused, valuable increment end-to-end—so you get working software plus a pattern your team can repeat.
deliverables: One production-ready feature (e.g., a RAG endpoint, evaluation harness, or workflow automation)
Security-first defaults (RBAC, data handling, auditability where needed)

items.title: AI Developer Enablement (Cursor / Claude Code)
items.description: Enable your engineering org to use AI coding tools effectively and safely—without turning the codebase into a prompt experiment.
deliverables: Team onboarding + workflows tailored to your repo
Templates for prompts, evals, and regression prevention

steps.title: Start with the process
steps.description: We map the real workflow and constraints (people, systems, risk, compliance) before choosing tech.

steps.title: Design for production from day one
steps.description: Security, observability, cost controls, and failure modes are part of the architecture—not a later phase.

steps.title: Ship in iterations with quality gates
steps.description: Small releases, measurable outcomes, and evaluation/monitoring so quality improves over time instead of drifting.

goodFit.title: Good fit if you’re building…
items: Enterprise LLM platform capabilities (multi-model routing, guardrails, auditability)
RAG systems that need quality control (retrieval strategy + evals, not just embeddings)
AWS-based event-driven architectures for AI workloads
A practical PromptOps / Evals approach to prevent regressions
An engineering org rollout of AI coding tools with clear standards

cta.title: Want to discuss a project?
cta.description: The fastest way is a short message with context: your goal, current state, constraints (security/compliance), and timeline expectations.
